Mathematicians have wrestled with this concept for centuries.  Hilbert's Hotel, a thought experiment, illustrates the  bizarreness of infinity. A seemingly full hotel with an infinite number of rooms can always accommodate a new guest, simply by shifting existing occupants to higher numbered rooms.
